basics.name: Francesco Di Donato
basics.label: Coder
basics.summary: Since I entered the world of code every morning I wake up adventurous to complete the challenges that a code too intricate has left open the night before; I enjoy the freedom and sharing of knowledge that takes place on the web. I like to tru my hand at building attractive interfaces and I feel deeply fascinated by the accuracy hidden behind a well-made server. I am constantly loking for carefully sought solutions and new concepts that can enhance my programming skills.

highlights: Chemical, physical, bacterial analysis of water samples

work.summary: In addition to bringing me to a better understanding of the English language, it is allowing me to self-finance my web developing studies. This job allowed me to know the working reality immediately after the academic one.

publications.name: Express server template
publications.summary: My personal setup for an express app that uses mongoose to establish a connection with MongoDB and passport.js in order to manage the authentication of users.

publications.name: Study of Next.js
publications.summary: This project (still ongoing) implements a custom server within the next.js frame. Featuring passport.js, mongoose, material-UI, it also shows an elaborate internal architecture based on the concept of DRY. In this project both SSR and Static Generation are used.
